numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a pattern in the survey results.
2. In most surveyed countries, many 15-24-year-olds say that the world is getting better with every generation.
3. In most surveyed countries, fewer people who are 40 years old or older say that the world is getting better with every generation.
4. Indonesia has a high rating for the statement that the world gets better with every generation.
5. In Indonesia, this high rating occurs for all surveyed age groups.
6. Each country has a dot in the graph.
7. The graph has a black line.
8. If a dot is close to the black line then the two age groups agree more.
9. Morocco is close to the black line.
10. Nigeria is close to the black line.
11. India is close to the black line.
12. In Morocco, the two age groups have almost the same opinion.
13. In Nigeria, the two age groups have almost the same opinion.
14. In India, the two age groups have almost the same opinion.
15. In each country, about 21000 people or more were interviewed by phone.
16. I wonder if some areas in a country have different opinions.
17. I wonder if opinions in some areas contrast with opinions in other areas.
18. The survey was conducted only by telephone.
19. If many people in a country do not have access to a phone then the survey results can be biased.
20. A good name for the graph is "The Older and Younger Generations Hope for the World".
